strings.Text.d5977ea9: Select dropdown to convert N format
strings.Text.271daaea: Intro: RSA PATCH TOOLKIT is not for real factorization,
strings.Text.de7ac42f: just for fun and CRC32 patch assistance.
strings.Text.83a035d4: Special Thanks: Shu Miao Duo for life support.
strings.Text.644955d1: Kind must be one of hex / HEX / bytes / dec / base64
strings.Text.76283e9e: A dec only allows '0'..'9' with length ≥1
strings.Text.f672922b: B dec only allows '0'..'9' with length ≥1
strings.Text.23596565: A base64 length invalid: len mod 4 ≠ 1
strings.Text.658b5001: B base64 length invalid: len mod 4 ≠ 1
strings.Text.75a687a8: hex text length must be even (2N)
strings.Text.fa6fd39e: allowedChars empty after removing '=', cannot random fill
strings.Text.bdcd1f42: [LOG] Cannot write app dir, log fallback to:
strings.Text.1f983e67: Cannot write to app dir, log fallback to:
strings.Text.4c8d78f4: [LOG] Note: Cannot write to EXE dir, log fallback to a writable path.
strings.Text.b77d26c6: Note : Logged only when fallback file first created.
strings.Text.c6b74c91: No original string, cannot edit mask.
strings.Text.61243d4c: Change at A tail "=" canceled; reset to "*"
strings.Text.fc2ee7be: A ends with "=" (Base64 padding). Changing may alter length.
strings.Text.c3fbcf86: Mask length must equal A length (
strings.Text.b1fbcad1: • Goal: Use B mask to overwrite A; '' = keep.
strings.Text.4ade3dad: • A: Read-only; click A → move B cursor.
strings.Text.1acdac63: • B: Type to replace last ''; press '' / Backspace / Delete to reset.
strings.Text.3a57610b: • Highlight: Active pos bold/red; fixed bits blue.
strings.Text.f2ad17a9: • Scroll: Only B shows horizontal bar; A/B pixel-synced.
strings.Text.22461aa0: • [Save & Random Fill]: Freeze zone + variant save.
strings.Text.2379ad29: • Note: If A ends with '=' (Base64 padding), edits require confirmation.
strings.Text.98ad608a: Invalid Base64 length (len % 4 = 1), cannot fix by '='.
strings.Text.748f3c02: Paste source data first, then click Start
strings.Text.318ba4e9: <color=red>Dry Run: print partial mutations, skip factoring.</color>
strings.Text.ea4ba433: Mask unsolvable, revert to original N. Continue
strings.Text.a0900ee7: <color=red>No variants found (try longer input / relax freeze).</color>
strings.Text.b7177565: . Try RSATool2 or similar tool if needed.
strings.Text.6a2ec8b4: Original RSA block cannot be negative.
strings.Text.027e49f5: Integer too large for this block.
strings.Text.94d59c34: Cipher length not multiple of block size.
strings.Text.83141085: e not coprime with φ(n), inverse not found.
strings.Text.67d5e639: Key too small for padded encryption.
strings.Text.help: Part I: Quick Start Guide Welcome to RSA PATCH TOOLKIT! This section helps you quickly complete a full workflow — from pasting input to viewing results. Interface Overview Top: Input Area (Paste / Detect / Format Convert / Reverse). Middle: Parameters & Options (Byte-tweak mode, Fixed-CRC32 mode, and general options). Bottom: Actions & Log (Start / Stop / Clear Log / Help / Log Window). Quick Start Click Paste [P] to import N; the program auto-detects format (Hex / Decimal / Base64). If detection is incorrect, click isHEX / isDecimal / isBase64 to manually correct it (no conversion triggered). Need format conversion? Just change the Format Dropdown (e.g., Hex → Base64). Choose a running mode: Byte-Tweak Mode: set “Try Replace Position” and “Direction”; optional “By Half-Byte” and “Input HEX Is String”. Fixed-CRC32 Mode: click Mask to define variable (*) and frozen bits; configure allowed charset and Unicode toggle. Click Start. Candidates appear in the log window; differing positions are highlighted in bold red. Common Shortcuts Reverse [R]: works only for Hex; reverses by byte order. Dry Run: simulates the workflow without real computation. Help: outputs built-in examples (with annotations). Part II: Option Details Top Input Area TextN: input box for N; supports Hex / Decimal / Base64. ComboFormat: switch display / conversion format (HEX / hex / Decimal / Base64). Paste [P]: cleans whitespace and auto-detects format; Base64 auto-pads “=”. Reverse [R]: for Hex, reverses every 2 characters (1 byte) as a block. isHEX / isDecimal / isBase64 / isHex(lower): only changes the dropdown label, does not convert content. Middle Option Area Byte-Tweak Mode Try Replace Position (1-based): set the starting point. Direction: Current only / Left / Right. By Half-Byte: tweak on nibble (high/low 4 bits). Input HEX Is String: treat HEX as character string or raw bytes. Fixed-CRC32 Mode Mask: use “*” for variable positions; other chars are frozen. Allowed Charset: restrict candidate characters (Hex / Dec / Base64 / custom). Unicode: toggle between ASCII and Unicode (UTF-16LE) modes. Required Character Count: sets number of editable characters. General Options Dry Run: log the process without computation. RSA Test: perform random encrypt/decrypt validation of N/D (math consistency). Brent Iterations: upper bound for Rho–Brent factor search. Trial Small Primes: enable basic trial division. Try Small Curves: number of small curves for ECM. Minimum Result Count: minimal number of generated candidates. Log Results: write candidates to the log. Thread Count: set parallelism level. Accept Prime N: allow N to be prime. Bottom Actions & Log Start: read options and run; results printed in rich-text RichTextLog with highlights. Stop: terminate the current task. Clear Log: clear all output. Help: show built-in help and examples. Mask Editor (FrmMaskEditor) Box A: displays the original string; frozen sections highlighted in blue; cursor linked highlight. Box B: edit the mask; “” = variable; deleting reverts to “”. Save / Save & Random Fill: validate and persist; can immediately generate one random candidate. Hint Area: dynamically shows allowed characters and length info.
